value.title: Democrats eye a comeback in Missouri, where post-Trump turmoil on display
value.excerpt: Recruiting is a challenge in a state Trump won by more than 15 percentage points last year and where Democrats have won only one statewide race in eight years.

value.title: Chris Ruddy and Newsmax went all-in on Trump. Now they might pay a price for it.
value.excerpt: The conservative media entrepreneur became Trump’s most quotable friend. His cable channel became one of the biggest promoters of Trump’s election-fraud fantasies.

value.title: The First Day of Donald Trump's New Website Recalls His Earlier 'Twitterstorms'
value.excerpt: The official Twitter account linked to Trump's new blog was banned from the social network shortly after it appeared online.

value.title: Judge rebukes William Barr for Mueller handling, orders DOJ to release Trump obstruction memo
value.excerpt: U.S. District Judge Amy Berman Jackson said AG William Barr had obscured "the true purpose of the memorandum" when it withheld the document.

value.title: ‘It really f--ks the other ‘24 wannabes' — How Facebook could give Trump a huge boost
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump’s potential reemergence on Facebook this week could dramatically upend politics. But it’s not the megaphone the platform offers him — it’s the money. Trump has not been on Facebook since it booted him in the wake of his encouragement of the January 6 riots at the Capitol.

value.title: Facebook and Trump are at a turning point in their long, tortured relationship
value.excerpt: Facebook’s decision to outsource the future of Trump’s account to an independent Oversight Board stems from a tortured relationship with the former president. It could also set a precedent on how social media companies handle politicians and on how they will balance free speech and harm.

value.title: Joe Biden raises Trump refugee cap after backlash
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden has lifted the US annual refugee cap, bowing to backlash from his party after he initially opted to stick by the Trump-era figure. The Democratic president is raising the cap from 15,

value.title: The Memo: Trump's critics face wrath of GOP base
value.excerpt: Cheney voted for Trump’s impeachment and has become perhaps his most persistent foe among GOP officeholders. But the bigger picture is one in which Cheney is in danger of losing her House leadership position and another Trump critic,

value.title: IRS chief counsel under Trump admin joins Gibson Dunn
value.excerpt: Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher on Monday announced it has tapped Michael Desmond, whose successful nomination to serve as chief counsel of the U.S. Internal Revenue Service was reportedly a personal priority for former President Donald Trump.

value.title: Trump Suggests Arizona Election Recount Will Go His Way: "Let's See What They Find"
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump suggested to guests at Mar-a-Lago on Thursday that a recount vote in Arizona could prove the 2020 election was "stolen" due to voter fraud. "Let's see what they find. I wouldn't be surprised if they found thousands and thousands and thousands of votes,

value.title: Lincoln Project taunts Trump, saying he lost to 'swamp,' McConnell
value.excerpt: The Lincoln Project is taunting former President Trump in a new attack ad, saying the former president got "played" by the Republican establishment in Washington, D.C.

value.title: Hilary Mantel, Mad Max and Donald Trump: what we learned from Sydney writers’ festival
value.excerpt: Judy Bloom, Paul Kelly, George Miller and Tara June Winch were among the guests at Carriageworks, in a welcome return for the beloved event

value.title: Trump is 'fixated' and talks 'constantly' about Arizona election recount, allies say
value.excerpt: Trump asks aides multiple times a day about the vote recount that is currently underway in Maricopa County, according to The Washington Post.

value.title: Watch Trump bid farewell to Mar-a-Lago members for the summer after yet another speech about the 'rigged' election
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump is planning to move his political operation to New Jersey for the summer.

value.title: President Trump fires FBI Director James Comey
value.excerpt: President Trump has fired FBI Director James Comey, which is only the second time an FBI director has been fired. CBSN contributor and Time politcal reporter Zeke Miller spoke with CBSN about Comey's dismissal.

value.title: Paul Ryan: Trump debate will fade as new candidates emerge
value.excerpt: Nearly six months after the presidential election, Republicans remain divided over former President Donald Trump

value.title: Kinzinger goes to Texas in search of anti-Trump Republicans
value.excerpt: Adam Kinzinger came to Texas this week to hunt unicorns. The Illinois congressman was looking for Republicans who, like him, see former President Donald Trump as a scourge on their party and a threat to democracy.

value.title: Trump 'Certainly' Considers Florida Gov. DeSantis As VP Running Mate In 2024
value.excerpt: Trump discussed a potential run for president in 2024. “And the polls show that everybody wants me to do it," he told Fox's Maria Bartiromo.

value.title: Former Trump official Zinke eyes Montana's new US House seat
value.excerpt: Former Montana congressman and Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke has filed election paperwork indicating he is interested in running for the second U.S. House seat awarded to the state

value.title: Manhattan District Attorney Candidates Walk Tightrope on Trump Probe
value.excerpt: For Manhattan district attorney candidates talking about their experience in white-collar crime cases has become a sort of proxy for indirectly addressing the Trump investigation, which is both the office’s biggest case and off limits for debate.

value.title: ‘A great patriot’: Trump defends Giuliani after federal agents raid home and office
value.excerpt: Investigators execute search warrants at Rudy Giuliani’s Manhattan residence and office as part of Ukraine investigation

value.title: Cheney: 'Wishful thinking' by Trump she won't seek 4th term
value.excerpt: Liz Cheney calls speculation by former President Donald Trump that she won’t seek re-election next year “wishful thinking.”

value.title: Donald Trump Suggests He May Sue CNN Over Project Veritas Video Allegedly Proving Bias
value.excerpt: "This is like a campaign contribution of magnitudes like nobody's ever seen before," former President Donald Trump said of a Project Veritas video that secretly recorded a CNN employee describing the network's reporting as anti-Trump "propaganda.

value.title: Trump adviser Roger Stone says he was in a "suspicious" hit and run car accident
value.excerpt: Roger Stone, long-time adviser and confidant of President Trump, claims he was the victim of a "suspicious" hit-and-run car accident Wednesday. The crash comes days after Stone admitted to CBS News that he had made contact with a suspected Russian hacker.

value.title: Trump administration accuses Obama of wiretapping
value.excerpt: President Trump is calling for Congress to investigate his claim that the Obama administration wiretapped phones in Trump Tower during the presidential campaign. Associated Press White House reporter Vivian Salama joins CBSN to discuss.

value.title: D.C. officer who suffered heart attack on Jan. 6 calls out Trump for downplaying ‘brutal, savage’ riot
value.excerpt: Michael Fanone, a D.C. police officer who suffered a heart attack and concussion in the insurrection, criticized former president Donald Trump and other politicians for downplaying the severity of the Jan.

value.title: Melania Trump Thanks Supporters Who Sent Her 'Wonderful' Birthday Messages
value.excerpt: Melania Trump said she is thankful for the supporters and social media users who remembered her on her 51st birthday on Monday.

value.title: Lindsey Graham Announces Contest Where Winner Gets to Golf With Trump and Him
value.excerpt: "If you don't win, the money is going to be used to take back the House and the Senate, so we can stop this slide to socialism," Graham said.

value.title: Trump: ‘warmongering fool’ Liz Cheney would ‘embarrass her family’ with 2024 bid
value.excerpt: Liz Cheney telling The Post that she’s not ruling out a presidential bid. Trump called the Wyoming Republican a “warmongering fool” and said that she would “embarrass her family” with a 2024 run. “Liz Cheney is polling sooo low in Wyoming,

value.title: Donald Trump Says LeBron James' Remarks are 'Divisive, Nasty, Insulting'
value.excerpt: "LeBron James should focus on basketball rather than presiding over the destruction of the NBA," the former president said. "He may be a great basketball player, but he is doing nothing to bring our Country together.
